usefulItems: tart tin (Ø 26 cm), rolling pin, oven
title: Apple tart

ingredients.content: 75 g butter, unsalted, cut in pieces, plus extra for greasing
150 g plain flour, plus extra for flouring
900 - 1000 g apples (e.g. Granny Smith, Braeburn, Pink Lady, Pippin)

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 200°C. Grease and flour a tart tin (Ø 26 cm) and set aside.
Place butter, flour, salt, vanilla sugar and water in mixing bowl and mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>.
Using a rolling pin, roll out pastry on a lightly floured surface. Line prepared tart tin with pastry and set aside.

Peel apples, cut in quarters and remove core and pips. Cut apple quarters in thin slices and arrange in a fan pattern on top of pastry. Sprinkle with sugar and dot with small pieces of butter. Bake for 30-35 minutes (200°C) until apples are golden. Serve warm or cold.

hintsAndTricks: Add a layer of apple compote on top of pastry before arranging apple slices.
Sprinkle tart with ground cinnamon or ground hazelnuts before baking.
Give the tart a little shine: brush it after baking with <b>2 tbsp heated<b> apricot jam.
